com.phunware.alerts.models

Class PwSubscription

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.phunware.alerts.models.PwSubscription
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    android.os.Parcelable

    public class PwSubscription
extends java.lang.Object
implements android.os.Parcelable
    Object model to hold data for a subscription.

    Get a list of subscriptions from the server using PwAlertsSubscriptions.getSubscriptionGroups(Context context). This will return an array list of Subscription objects. Each subscription will have a populated id, name, isSubscribed, and list of PwSubscription children nodes (or sub-segments).

    The server maintains a subscription state however that state is not sent back in that call. The SDK stores this state for the subscribed subscriptions locally.

    When the Alerts module is first installed (either a fresh install, or first time running with Alerts module) a call is made to register the device for push alerts and after a successful registration a call is made to un-subscribe from all subscriptions. { "subscriptionGroups": [ { "id": "b82a20e6f7c6a08af40a5208276adabd3859fed0", "name": "Test Segment 1 (STAGE)", "children": [ ] }, { "id": "3646305ba2d9ff5a8325d4fe009a7f8c452be34f", "name": "Test Segment 2 (STAGE)", "children": [ ] }, { "id": "dc381504-dfb8-4b36-b372-635fc419b059", "name": "Parent Segment", "children": [ { "id": "01cc85d7-eca9-4a7f-b253-816351c0869c", "name": "Sub Segment 2" }, { "id": "8592becf-7f29-412f-af8c-117613f2d94f", "name": "Sub Segment" } ] } ] }

      • isSubscribed

        public boolean isSubscribed()
        Check if the user is subscribed to this subscription. This is false when first created. Developers must use setIsSubscribed(boolean) to enable or disable this flag.
        Returns:
        true is returned if this subscription is subscribed to, false if not.
